availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank A. McHarry (Louisville, Jefferson, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Francis McHarry and Emily McHarry. Married to Sarah Phipps McHarry in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 19, 1859. Served in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from October 3, 1862, to May 5, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 237B-238A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 672.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819610.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0409.
“Veteran of Civil War Dead,” Bureau County Tribune (Princeton, IL), May 03, 1901, p. 3.
